text: @FiDaisyG @stillawake @TRESAcic @Bristol_People @Totterdown_ @BristolCouncil @LabourBristol @nicolabeech @harbour_news @hccabristol @bgreencapital @GlobalSciShow @BathArchandCivE @EnvAgencySW @ICESouthWest @CIWEM surely this depends where a barrier is built. A barrier built futher downstream can make the river course a reservoir of astonomical capacity. The tidal range is what 13m? How many cubic metres is that? Surely eneough to take fluvial flow even in extreme conditions. More evidence
